title: complement for le corbusier
content:
hello typophile!  
i am working to a project in which i have to use a logo done with le corbusier oldface:

[http://www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Headline+Fonts/Le+Corbusier/Oldface/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130718080729/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Headline+Fonts/Le+Corbusier/Oldface/)

the client doesn't have any rule at all for corporate image so i was wondering about the choice of a text font to use with le corbusier (that i think to extend as display font for the project).  
my idea is to use a sans serif, relatively modern font to "isolate" titles and to stay neutral also because of the great strenght of the primary font, but all suggestions are really appreciated.  
thanks a lot, bye
author: mickmeg

comments.content: I think you could go for a serif, as long it's "modern" (in the didone sense) and that you don't use it in weights heavier than semibold.

Lineto's **Le Corbusier** is indeed drawn in the style of a »Didone« or Modernist/Romantic letter.
For a Bodoni that is suitable for extended text, you have three good choices:
ITC Bodoni
Bauer Bodoni
Berthold Bodoni
The last two date from 1924–26 and 1930, respectively; a period when Le Corbusier was active. Other Romantic faces would include **Didot** and **Walbaum**. However, you specifically mentioned that you are looking for a sans serif. Here the task is more difficult, but it is not inconceivable to pair a Romantic Modernist serif with a Geometric Modernist sans serif such as **Futura** (c. 1925) or even **[Memphis](http://web.archive.org/web/20130718080729/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/memphis/)** (c. 1929). Better still, **[Akzidenz Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20130718080729/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/bq_library/AkzidenzGrotesk.html)** traces its geneology to the letterforms of Walbaum, and you may have an easier time harmonizing it with Le Corbusier.
[Figgins Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20130718080729/http:/www.shinntype.com/figgins.html), an even more recherché Helvetica than AG :-)
in effect i was looking for a serif also because i wanted to reach a sort of consistency when moving to the web. thanks a lot for suggestions.
